trans-unit.source: Represents a WMI instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementObject"></xref> class.
This is the default constructor.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementObject"></xref> class for the specified WMI object path.
The path is provided as a <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref>.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref> that contains a path to a WMI object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementObject"></xref> class for the specified WMI object path.
The path is provided as a string.

If the specified path is a relative path only (a server or namespace is not specified), the default path is the local machine, and the default namespace is the <xref:System.Management.ManagementPath.DefaultPath%2A> path (by default, root\cimv2).
If the user specifies a full path, the default settings are overridden.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A WMI path.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementObject"></xref> class bound to the specified WMI path, including the specified additional options.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref> containing the WMI path.
An <xref href="System.Management.ObjectGetOptions"></xref> containing additional options for binding to the WMI object.
This parameter could be null if default options are to be used.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementObject"></xref> class that is serializable.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination (see <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>) for this serialization.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementObject"></xref> class bound to the specified WMI path, including the specified additional options.
In this variant, the path can be specified as a string.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The WMI path to the object.
An <xref href="System.Management.ObjectGetOptions"></xref> representing options to get the specified WMI object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementObject"></xref> class bound to the specified WMI path that includes the specified options.
Because WMI paths can be relative or full, a conflict between the scope and the path specified may arise.
However, if a scope is specified and a relative WMI path is specified, then there is no conflict.
The following are some possible conflicts:
If a scope is not specified and a relative WMI path is specified, then the scope will default to the local machine's <xref:System.Management.ManagementPath.DefaultPath%2A>.
If a scope is not specified and a full WMI path is specified, then the scope will be inferred from the scope portion of the full path.
For example, the full WMI path: `\\MyMachine\root\MyNamespace:MyClass.Name='abc'` will represent the WMI object 'MyClass.Name='abc'" in the scope '\\\MyMachine\root\MyNamespace'.
If a scope is specified and a full WMI path is specified, then the scope will override the scope portion of the full path.

For example, if the following scope was specified: \\\MyMachine\root\MyScope, and the following full path was specified: \\\MyMachine\root\MyNamespace:MyClass.Name='abc', then look for the following `object: \\MyMachine\root\MyScope:MyClass.Name= 'abc'` (the scope part of the full path is ignored).
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementScope"></xref> representing the scope in which the WMI object resides.
In this version, scopes can only be WMI namespaces.
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref> representing the WMI path to the manageable object.
An <xref href="System.Management.ObjectGetOptions"></xref> specifying additional options for getting the object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Management.ManagementObject"></xref> class bound to the specified WMI path, and includes the specified options.
The scope and the path are specified as strings.
See the equivalent overload for details.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.

For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The scope for the WMI object.
The WMI object path.
An <xref href="System.Management.ObjectGetOptions"></xref> representing additional options for getting the WMI object.
Gets or sets the path to the object's class.
This property is read-only.

Releases all resources used by the Component.
Binds WMI class information to the management object.
The method is implicitly invoked at the first attempt to get or set information to the WMI object.
It can also be explicitly invoked at the user's discretion, to better control the timing and manner of retrieval.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Binds to the management object asynchronously.
The method will issue the request to get the object and then will immediately return.
The results of the operation will then be delivered through events being fired on the watcher object provided.

An <xref href="System.Management.InvokeMethodOptions"></xref> containing additional options for the execution of the method.
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref> containing the output parameters and return value of the executed method.
Invokes a method on the object, asynchronously.
The method invokes the specified method execution and then returns.
Progress and results are reported through events on the <xref:System.Management.ManagementOperationObserver>.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementOperationObserver"></xref> used to handle the asynchronous execution's progress and results.
The name of the method to be executed.
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref> containing the input parameters for the method.
An <xref href="System.Management.InvokeMethodOptions"></xref> containing additional options used to execute the method.
Gets or sets additional information to use when retrieving the object.
When the property is changed after the management object has been bound to a WMI object, the management object is disconnected from the original WMI object and later rebound using the new options.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
An <xref href="System.Management.ObjectGetOptions"></xref> to use when retrieving the object.
Gets or sets the object's WMI path.
Changing the property after the management object has been bound to a WMI object in a particular namespace results in releasing the original WMI object.
This causes the management object to be rebound to the new object specified by the new path properties and scope values.
The rebinding is performed in a "lazy" manner, that is, only when a requested value requires the management object to be bound to the WMI object.
Changes can be made to more than just the property before attempting to rebind (for example, modifying the scope and path properties simultaneously).
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
A <xref href="System.Management.ManagementPath"></xref> representing the object's path.
Commits the changes to the object.

Commits the changes to the object, asynchronously.

Gets or sets the scope in which this object resides.
Changing this property after the management object has been bound to a WMI object in a particular namespace results in releasing the original WMI object.
This causes the management object to be rebound to the new object specified by the new path properties and scope values.
The rebinding is performed in a "lazy" manner, that is, only when a requested value requires the management object to be bound to the WMI object.
Changes can be made to more than just this property before attempting to rebind (for example, modifying the scope and path properties simultaneously).
